clinical_notes: May have difficulty with complex phone tasks but basic use intact.
information_needs: Simplification strategies; contact lists; emergency numbers

clinical_notes: May have difficulty with shopping for multiple items or in unfamiliar stores.
information_needs: Shopping lists; routine stores; companion shopping

clinical_notes: Can still prepare familiar meals but may have difficulty with complex new recipes.
information_needs: Simplified recipes; meal planning; safety tips

clinical_notes: Housekeeping generally maintained but organizational capacity decreasing.
information_needs: Routine establishment; checklists; simplified tasks

clinical_notes: Can perform laundry but may need reminders or routines.
information_needs: Routine schedules; simplified sorting; clear labeling

clinical_notes: Difficulty traveling to new locations; may get lost in unfamiliar areas.
information_needs: Familiar routes only; GPS aids; driving assessment; alternative transport

clinical_notes: May forget doses or timing; pill organizers helpful.
information_needs: Pill organizers; alarms; caregiver monitoring; medication review

clinical_notes: Decreased ability to handle complex finances; bill paying and budgeting affected.
information_needs: Financial oversight; automatic payments; simplified accounts; fraud protection

clinical_notes: ADLs mostly independent but may need prompting for bathing.
information_needs: Bathing routines; reminders; safety modifications (grab bars)

clinical_notes: Can dress independently but may need prompting or weather-appropriate selection.
information_needs: Laying out clothes; weather-appropriate selection; simplified closet

clinical_notes: Toileting remains independent though may need reminders.
information_needs: Toileting schedule; clear bathroom signage

clinical_notes: Transfers remain independent in mild AD.
information_needs: Fall prevention; decluttering; adequate lighting

clinical_notes: Feeding independent; may need assistance with food selection.

clinical_notes: Difficulty with complex phone tasks; may forget how to use features.

clinical_notes: Can prepare simple meals but needs supervision for safety.

fast_stage: # Purpose: Map 16 FAST stages to ADL/IADL functional capabilities with impairment levels
# - Independent: Can perform activity without any assistance
# - Requires Prompting: Can perform with verbal cues and reminders
# - Requires Assistance: Needs physical help or setup to complete activity
# - Impaired: Activity is affected but not completely dependent
# - Dependent: Cannot perform activity; complete assistance required
# - Dependent - [Specific]: Complete dependency with specific characteristic (e.g.

information_needs: Finances)

fast_stage: # - Total entries: 16 stages × 14 capabilities = 224 stage-capability mappings
# - ADL decline sequence in stages 5-6: Bathing → Dressing → Toileting → Transferring → Continence → Feeding
# - FAST 6a-6e correspond precisely to Katz ADL decline sequence
# - All IADLs completely dependent by stage 6a
# - Stage 7 (all substages) represents complete dependency in all ADLs and IADLs

capability_type: B. (1988). Functional assessment staging (FAST). Psychopharmacology Bulletin

capability_id: et al. (1963). Studies of illness in the aged: The index of ADL. JAMA

capability_name: E.M. (1969). Assessment of older people: self-maintaining and instrumental activities of daily living. Gerontologist

fast_stage: # - Alzheimer's Association care guidelines and stage-specific recommendations
# - Information items should be tagged with applicable FAST stages and capabilities
# - Information needs column provides guidance on types of information required at each stage
# - Stage-specific and capability-specific information can be precisely targeted
# - Each row represents an instance of stage-capability relationship
# - Impairment level becomes object property value
# - Clinical notes provide context for semantic annotations
# - Users can query by FAST stage to retrieve all capability impairments
